items.title: ScatterBrain Mini App
items.desc: Points-based to-do app built on custom Sanity.io data structure to help with household chores and daily tasks for the kids. Also see the repo's hosted version on GitHub Pages.

items.title: Table Component API Design
items.desc: Early stages of React component architecture and API design for a data-table with additional scroll and overflow features while retaining HTML attribute passing for row and cell child elements.

items.title: Hey Nova Blog
items.desc: Multiple accessibility-focused blog posts written for Hey Nova agency over multiple years, before and during period of working on the team.

items.title: Sensory Filtering and Focus
items.desc: Text and visual diagram to illustrate the incoming stimuli and brain's filtering abilities for neuro-typical and neuro-divergent brains in various states. Choose the brain type and focus mode to see each state.

items.title: What's Up Mini App
items.desc: Single-page reference to collect listings of multiple events venues around Kitchener-Waterloo for the current date. Many links have changed formatting, but you can still check out the GitHub Pages static site from the repo.

items.title: 'Why is a11y important?' Blog Post
items.desc: Detailed 3-part blog post responding to the all-too-common question of why accessibility is important - both on the web and in the physical world. Written while working on a design team and fielding general a11y questions from developers.

items.title: Grid System with CSS Grid
items.desc: Proof-of-concept for a flexible grid system built using CSS Grid, featuring multiple column sizes and levels of nesting. Built to compare with the Flexbox alternative.

items.title: Grid System with Flexbox
items.desc: Proof-of-concept for a flexible grid system built using Flexbox, featuring multiple column sizes and levels of nesting. Built to compare with the Grid alternative.

items.title: Card Components Example
items.desc: Basic card components with single or multiple inner links and optional call-to-action. Based on Heydon Pickering's 'Inclusive Components' to show a keyboard and screen reader friendly structure.

items.title: 'Hire More Punks' Blog Post
items.desc: A tongue-in-cheek blog post on Medium about hiring punks to mitigate many cultural issues within 'big tech'. Written in 2019 while working as a hiring manager and partnered with a technical recruiter.

items.title: Animated Pokéball SVG
items.desc: Playing with SVG and CSS animation to bring a simple Pokéball graphic to life. Try hovering and clicking on the ball to see the whole thing in action.

items.title: StopGap Website
items.desc: Website built as sole-developer freelance work for the Toronto-based StopGap Foundation. End of a personal era of working with WordPress for web development, circa 2016/17.
